name: Talk Titus
_source: multi_add_portrait;Simon;Left;Titus;Right
s;Simon;So Titus, what brings the Wandering Knights here of all places?{w}{br}Why so interested in Vesner's corpse?
s;Titus;To be honest, it's the only thing we could all settle on.
s;Titus;Being part of the knights has been... {w}frustrating lately.{w}{br}So much arguing that it's hard to get anything done!

s;Titus;But we could all agree that Vesner's old lands needed to be cleaned up.{w}{br}The monsters could eventually creep into surrounding villages,{w}{br}perhaps even as far south as Morrissey's lands.
s;Simon;Funny you should mention that.{w}{br}We're working with Morrissey now, actually.
s;Titus;Really? How's working with him been?{w}{br}Haven't heard much, but you need to be a real ruthless bastard to control that much land nowadays.
s;Simon;He's been helpful. He'll likely aid us in restoring House Verstadt.
s;Titus;By the Fates! Are you the new lord of House Verstadt?{w}{br}I knew you looked familiar!
s;Simon;Yeah, I'm Bertholdt Verstadt's son, Simon.
s;Titus;Well, Simon, back when I was a captain for House Charin, I met your old man a few times.
s;Titus;And,{w} well,{w} sorry to hear about what happened.{w}{br}Losing your home hurts.{w}{br}It was the same for me when Lord Charin was overthrown and the loyalists were cast out.
s;Simon;What happened? {w}That was all a bit before my time.
s;Titus;Well, some subjects were clamoring for a say in how things were run.{w}{br}Naturally, Charin wanted that nonsense quashed immediately.
s;Titus;But we... {w}underestimated how much support their movement had.{w}{br}We put up a good fight, but we were outnumbered.
s;Titus;Charin was done for.
wait;300
s;Titus;I only wish we had someone like Morrisey to help us out back then.
s;Simon;I'm sorry to hear that, Titus.
s;Titus;All you can do is move forward.{w}{br}And hey, if you need help restoring your house, I'm all in.
s;Titus;The noble houses are really the only way to keep this crumbling world in order.
s;Simon;We'll be glad to have your help.
